maml:description.maml:para: Get an auth key.
Retrieves the `cdnAuthKeys` for a specific Akamai `contractId` and specific third-party CDN (`cdnCode`). Auth Keys can be specified when running `New-CloudWrapperConfiguration`.
Your contract's ID.
The ID Akamai uses for a third-party content delivery network (CDN). Run `Get-CloudWrapperProvider` to get these values.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
The ID Akamai uses for a third-party content delivery network (CDN). Run `Get-CloudWrapperProvider` to get these values.
Your contract's ID.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
List capacity.
Returns the capacities available for a given `-ContractID`.
A list of contract IDs with Cloud Wrapper entitlement. Run `Get-Contract` from the `Akamai.Property` module to retrieve these.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
A list of contract IDs with Cloud Wrapper entitlement. Run `Get-Contract` from the `Akamai.Property` module to retrieve these.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
Get a configuration.
Returns a specific Cloud Wrapper configuration by its `-ConfigID`, or list all existing configurations.
Your Cloud Wrapper configuration's ID.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

List locations.
Retrieves the locations available to distribute your Cloud Wrapper capacity. This operation lists the available `trafficTypeId` values for use when creating configurations.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
List origins.

Returns a list of origin servers configured in eligible delivery properties. Response data is pulled from the property as it is shown in the Property API. At least one origin server entry is shown at the top level for the `default` rule. If additional origin servers are set in child-level rules in the same property, they're revealed at a lower level.
Your property's ID. You can find this with the `Get-Property` command in the `Akamai.Property` module.
Your contract's ID.
Your group's ID. You can find this with the `Get-Property` command in the `Akamai.Property` module.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).

Your contract's ID.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
Your group's ID. You can find this with the `Get-Property` command in the `Akamai.Property` module.
Your property's ID. You can find this with the `Get-Property` command in the `Akamai.Property` module.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
List properties.
Retrieves a list of properties for delivery products that are eligible to enable Cloud Wrapper.
A list of contract IDs with Cloud Wrapper entitlement. Run `Get-Contract` from the `Akamai.Property` module to retrieve these.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
When enabled, the response contains only unused properties.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
A list of contract IDs with Cloud Wrapper entitlement. Run `Get-Contract` from the `Akamai.Property` module to retrieve these.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
When enabled, the response contains only unused properties.
List CDN providers.
Retrieves a list of CDN providers.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).

Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
Create a configuration.
Create a Cloud Wrapper configuration, either as a JSON string or PSCustomObject, and optionally activate upon creation with the `-Activate` switch.
Verify your capacity by running `Get-CloudWrapperCapacity`, and you can work with your account team to include Cloud Wrapper locations and capacity on your contract.
A request body, either as a `PSCustomObject `or a string. This parameter supports pipelining.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
When enabled, activates the modified configuration. You can then run `New-CloudWrapperActivation` separately.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
When enabled, activates the modified configuration. You can then run `New-CloudWrapperActivation` separately.
A request body, either as a `PSCustomObject `or a string. This parameter supports pipelining.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
Activate a configuration.
Activates a Cloud Wrapper configuration. It takes 3-4 hours for the configuration to complete.
You can use the configuration's `configId` to run the `Get-CloudWrapperConfiguration` operation and review its `status`. Once it's `ACTIVE`, enable the Cloud Wrapper behavior in your property.
To deactivate a configuration, run `Set-CloudWrapperConfiguration` and add the `-Deactivate` switch.
An array of configuration IDs, which can be piped, or a comma-separated string.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
An array of configuration IDs, which can be piped, or a comma-separated string.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
Delete a configuration.
Deletes a specific Cloud Wrapper configuration. The delete can take up to three hours to complete.

You can use the configuration's `configId` to run the `Get-CloudWrapperConfiguration` operation to check the status. `DELETE_IN_PROGRESS` indicates the request has been accepted. A 404 response indicates the configuration has been deleted.

Before you delete a configuration, ensure that all the properties that use it have the Cloud Wrapper behavior disabled. Then run the `Set-CloudWrapperConfiguration` operation to deactivate it by providing the `-Deactivate` switch.
Your Cloud Wrapper configuration's ID.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
Your Cloud Wrapper configuration's ID.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
Update a configuration.
Updates a saved or inactive configuration.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
When enabled, activates the modified configuration. You can then run `New-CloudWrapperActivation` separately.
A request body, either as a `PSCustomObject `or a string. This parameter supports pipelining.

A request body, either as a `PSCustomObject `or a string. This parameter supports pipelining.
Your Cloud Wrapper configuration's ID.
When enabled, deactivates the configuration, which is required before it can be deleted.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

When enabled, activates the modified configuration. You can then run `New-CloudWrapperActivation` separately.
